newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia wants local content in telecoms.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia wants local content in telecoms.

text.p: The Australian government said on Wednesday that new carriers entering the telecommunications industry next year will need to have local content plans.

Industry minister John Moore said that from July 1 next year, when the telecoms sector is deregulated, new carriers will be required under licensing provisions to have an industry plan covering proposed involvement with Australian-based suppliers.
"On this matter, I will make decisions on exemptions from the industry plan requirements on a case-by-case basis," he said in a speech to a telecommunications conference.
Moore said major international suppliers would continue to be encouraged to join the government's partnership for development programme or fixed term arrangement programmmes.
He also said the government would establish a new independent monitoring body to oversee the industry from July next year, replacing the existing Telecommunications Industry Development Authority.
"Over the next few months I will consider the nature and composition of the body which will provide advice on the continued growth of Australian industries during this time of dramatic change."
